metadata.title: CVE-2019-11191 on Ubuntu 18.04 LTS (bionic) - negligible
metadata.description:
** DISPUTED ** The Linux kernel through 5.0.7, when CONFIG_IA32_AOUT isenabled and ia32_aout is loaded, allows local users to bypass ASLR onsetuid a.out programs (if any exist) because install_exec_creds() is calledtoo late in load_aout_binary() in fs/binfmt_aout.c, and thus theptrace_may_access() check has a race condition when reading /proc/pid/stat.NOTE: the software maintainer disputes that this is a vulnerability becauseASLR for a.out format executables has never been supported.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-11191` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.15.0-51-generic - 4.15.0-51.55
linux-image-4.15.0-51-generic-lpae - 4.15.0-51.55
linux-image-4.15.0-51-lowlatency - 4.15.0-51.55
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-51-generic - 4.15.0-51.55
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-51-lowlatency - 4.15.0-51.55
No subscription required

linux-image-4.15.0-1037-raspi2 - 4.15.0-1037.39
No subscription required

linux-image-4.15.0-1054-snapdragon - 4.15.0-1054.58
No subscription required

linux-image-4.15.0-1040-aws - 4.15.0-1040.42
No subscription required

linux-image-4.18.0-21-generic - 4.18.0-21.22~18.04.1
linux-image-4.18.0-21-generic-lpae - 4.18.0-21.22~18.04.1
linux-image-4.18.0-21-lowlatency - 4.18.0-21.22~18.04.1
linux-image-4.18.0-21-snapdragon - 4.18.0-21.22~18.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.18.0-21-generic - 4.18.0-21.22~18.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.18.0-21-lowlatency - 4.18.0-21.22~18.04.1
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1033-gke - 4.15.0-1033.35
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-5.0.0-1011-gke - 5.0.0-1011.11~18.04.1
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-4.18.0-1019-azure - 4.18.0-1019.19~18.04.1
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1033-gcp - 4.15.0-1033.35
No subscription required

linux-image-4.15.0-1035-kvm - 4.15.0-1035.35
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1039-oem - 4.15.0-1039.44
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1014-oracle - 4.15.0-1014.16
No subscription required

criterions.comment: linux package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-51.55').
linux-raspi2 package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1037.39').
linux-snapdragon package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1054.58').
linux-aws package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1040.42').
linux-hwe package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.18.0-21.22~18.04.1').
linux-gke-4.15 package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1033.35').
linux-gke-5.0 package in bionic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '5.0.0-1011.11~18.04.1').
linux-azure package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.18.0-1019.19~18.04.1').
linux-gcp package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1033.35').
linux-kvm package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1035.35').
linux-oem package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1039.44').
linux-oracle package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1014.16').
